intro: Centaurium serotinum, commonly known as late centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in moist meadows and along stream banks. The plant features slender stems with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, and the plant is known for its delicate appearance and ecological importance in supporting pollinators. Centaurium serotinum is also valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
